headline: Doomsday scenario or reality? Mass layoffs fuel fear of AI Armageddon
summary: Square and Cash App operator Block said it would slash nearly half its workforce as AI reshapes its business, fanning fears of mass layoffs to come.

content.title: Doomsday scenario or reality? Mass layoffs fuel fear of AI Armageddon
content.summary: Square and Cash App operator Block said it would slash nearly half its workforce as AI reshapes its business, fanning fears of mass layoffs to come.

headline: Jack Dorsey’s Block to Lay Off 40% of Its Workforce in AI Remake
summary: Block  the payments company founded by  Jack Dorsey  that includes Square and Cash App, said Thursday that it plans to lay off 40% of its workforce, or more than 4,000 employees.  Dorsey alluded to artificial-intelligence tools as the reason for the cuts in a letter to shareholders.  “The core thesis is simple,” wrote Dorsey.

content.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block to Lay Off 40% of Its Workforce in AI Remake
content.summary: Block  the payments company founded by  Jack Dorsey  that includes Square and Cash App, said Thursday that it plans to lay off 40% of its workforce, or more than 4,000 employees.  Dorsey alluded to artificial-intelligence tools as the reason for the cuts in a letter to shareholders.  “The core thesis is simple,” wrote Dorsey.

headline: Block lays off nearly half its staff because of AI. Its CEO said most companies will do the same
summary: Block, the company behind Square, Cash App and Afterpay, is cutting its staff by 40%. The reason: “intelligence tools,” according to a letter to shareholders by co-founder Jack Dorsey.

headline: AI Crushed Software Stocks. Now It’s Saving Them.
summary: Panic over a software-business disruption from AI appears to have subsided after Anthropic showcased its partnership with Salesforce and other companies.

content.title: AI Crushed Software Stocks. Now It’s Saving Them.

headline: Fintech company Block lays off 4,000 of its 10,000 staff, citing gains from AI
summary: Shares in the financial technology company Block have soared more than 20% in after-hours trading after its CEO announced it was laying off more than 4,000 of its 10,000 some employees due to its use of artificial intelligence.  Dorsey's comments explicitly naming AI as a key driver behind the move were also posted on X, or Twitter, a company he co-founded.  Block’s shares gained 5% Thursday to $54.53, before it reported its earnings.

content.title: Fintech company Block lays off 4,000 of its 10,000 staff, citing gains from AI
content.summary: Shares in the financial technology company Block have soared more than 20% in after-hours trading after its CEO announced it was laying off more than 4,000 of its 10,000 some employees due to its use of artificial intelligence.  Dorsey's comments explicitly naming AI as a key driver behind the move were also posted on X, or Twitter, a company he co-founded.  Block’s shares gained 5% Thursday to $54.53, before it reported its earnings.

headline: Asian shares are mixed after Nvidia's losses pull Wall St lower, as AI-linked layoffs rattle markets
summary: Shares were mixed Friday in Asia after the worst day for Nvidia’s stock since last spring dragged U.S. stocks lower.  U.S. futures fell as investors focused on comments by Block CEO Jack Dorsey on his company’s decision to lay off 40% of its workforce because of labor-saving artificial intelligence.

summary: Block has been restructuring its business model and staffing since 2024 as the company’s stock has lagged.  At the same time, the company has invested heavily in AI tools to run more efficiently, including building its own tool called Goose.

headline: Nvidia Looks Like a Value Stock Even as Earnings Scream Growth
summary: The stock is priced at about 22 times forward earnings, well below its five-year average of 37 and barely above the S&P 500’s multiple.  “There’s something of a disconnect between how strong the results were and the stock not doing better,” said Robert Pavlik, senior portfolio manager at Dakota Wealth Management, which owns Nvidia shares.

content.title: Nvidia Looks Like a Value Stock Even as Earnings Scream Growth
content.summary: The stock is priced at about 22 times forward earnings, well below its five-year average of 37 and barely above the S&P 500’s multiple.  “There’s something of a disconnect between how strong the results were and the stock not doing better,” said Robert Pavlik, senior portfolio manager at Dakota Wealth Management, which owns Nvidia shares.

headline: AI Job Cuts Drive 11% WiseTech, 23% Block Share Surge
summary: This article first appeared on GuruFocus.  Morningstar analysts are warning that the AI narrative running through markets may be tilting more toward cost destruction than value creation.  In a note Thursday, analyst Lochlan Halloway wrote that investors appear squarely focused on what artificial intelligence might eliminate, rather than the incremental value it could unlock.

content.title: AI Job Cuts Drive 11% WiseTech, 23% Block Share Surge
content.summary: This article first appeared on GuruFocus.  Morningstar analysts are warning that the AI narrative running through markets may be tilting more toward cost destruction than value creation.  In a note Thursday, analyst Lochlan Halloway wrote that investors appear squarely focused on what artificial intelligence might eliminate, rather than the incremental value it could unlock.

headline: US stock futures falter on AI jitters, Nasdaq braces for steep monthly fall
summary: U.S. stock index futures slid on Friday as growing AI unease weighed on technology stocks, with the Nasdaq staring at its steepest monthly drop since March 2025, ‌and investors awaited key inflation data later in the day. Technology stocks saw immense turbulence this month ‌due to AI concerns, even as investors fretted about the payoff from massive planning spending on artificial-intelligence technology. Brewing tariff uncertainty also ​stoked volatility after the U.S. Supreme Court last week voided most of the duties U.S. President Donald Trump imposed last year.

content.title: US stock futures falter on AI jitters, Nasdaq braces for steep monthly fall
content.summary: U.S. stock index futures slid on Friday as growing AI unease weighed on technology stocks, with the Nasdaq staring at its steepest monthly drop since March 2025, ‌and investors awaited key inflation data later in the day. Technology stocks saw immense turbulence this month ‌due to AI concerns, even as investors fretted about the payoff from massive planning spending on artificial-intelligence technology. Brewing tariff uncertainty also ​stoked volatility after the U.S. Supreme Court last week voided most of the duties U.S. President Donald Trump imposed last year.
